original: a'arya sha t'a ksha ra bidy'a /
analyzed: a'arya sha t'a ksha ra bidy'a /

original: 'phags pa yi ge drug pa zhes bya ba'i rig sngags /
analyzed: 'phags pa yi ge drug pa zhes bya ba'i rig sngags /
translated: The six syllable mantra of the noble Avalokiteśvara

original: sangs rgyas dang / byang chub sems dpa' thams cad la phyag 'tshal lo; ;'di skad bdag gis thos pa'i dus gcig na /
analyzed: sangs rgyas dang / byang chub sems dpa' thams cad la phyag 'tshal lo; ;'di skad bdag gis thos pa'i dus gcig na /
translated: Homage to all the Buddhas and Bodhisattvas. Thus have I heard at one time:

original: bcom ldan 'das mnyan yod na bzhugs te /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das mnyan yod na bzhugs te /
translated: The Blessed One was dwelling in Śrāvastī.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis tshe dang ldan pa kun dga' bo la bka' stsal @459a *//
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis tshe dang ldan pa kun dga' bo la bka' stsal @459a *//
translated: Then the Blessed One said to the venerable Ānanda:

original: yi ge drug pa'i rig sngags gang yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas drug dang / 'jig rten skyong ba bzhi dang / gnod sbyin gyi sde dpon chen po nyi shu rtsa brgyad kyis bshad pa /
analyzed: yi ge drug pa'i rig sngags gang yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas drug dang / 'jig rten skyong ba bzhi dang / gnod sbyin gyi sde dpon chen po nyi shu rtsa brgyad kyis bshad pa /
translated: the six syllable mantra that was explained by the six perfect Buddhas, the four guardians of the world, and the twenty-eight great Yakṣa generals,

original: yi ge drug pa'i rig sngags kyi rgyal mo 'di kun dga' bo khyod kyis zungs shig /
analyzed: yi ge drug pa'i rig sngags kyi rgyal mo 'di kun dga' bo khyod kyis zungs shig /
translated: you, Ānanda, should uphold this queen of the six syllable mantras,

original: chongs shig / kun chub par gyis shig /🔽tadya th'a; danti le /
analyzed: chongs shig / kun chub par gyis shig / tadya th'a; danti le /

original: hu ta ba hu ni /🔽kun dga' bo /
analyzed: hu ta ba hu ni / kun dga' bo /

original: 'di ni / yi ge drug pa'i rig sngags so //🔽klad pa na ba dang / mig na ba dang / rna ba na ba dang / so na ba dang / sna na ba dang / lce na ba dang / snying na ba dang / lto ba na ba dang / rgya ba na ba dang /
analyzed: 'di ni / yi ge drug pa'i rig sngags so // klad pa na ba dang / mig na ba dang / rna ba na ba dang / so na ba dang / sna na ba dang / lce na ba dang / snying na ba dang / lto ba na ba dang / rgya ba na ba dang /
translated: Ānanda, this is the six-syllable awareness formula.🔽headache, eye pain, ear pain, toothache, nose pain, tongue pain, heart pain, stomach pain,

original: rtsib logs na ba dang / chu so na ba dang / byin pa na ba dang / rkang pa na ba dang / yan lag na ba dang / nying lag na ba dang / zas ma zhu ba dang / sbos pa dang / mngal du thogs pa dang /
analyzed: rtsib logs na ba dang / chu so na ba dang / byin pa na ba dang / rkang pa na ba dang / yan lag na ba dang / nying lag na ba dang / zas ma zhu ba dang / sbos pa dang / mngal du thogs pa dang /
translated: pain in the sides, pain in the bladder, pain in the thighs, pain in the legs, pain in the limbs, pain in the joints, indigestion, constipation, difficult childbirth,

original: rlung las gyur pa dang / mkhris pa las gyur pa dang / bad kan las gyur pa dang / 'dus pa las gyur pa dang; rims drag po dang / nyin gcig pa dang / nyin gnyis pa dang / nyin gsum pa dang / nyin bzhi pa dang /🔽rims yud tsam pa dang / nyin mo'i rims dang / mtshan mo'i @459b rims kyis btab pa la yi ge drug pa'i rig sngags 'dis bsrung ba dang / yongs su bskyab pa dang / yongs su bsrung ba dang / yongs su bskyang ba dang / zhi ba dang /
analyzed: rlung las gyur pa dang / mkhris pa las gyur pa dang / bad kan las gyur pa dang / 'dus pa las gyur pa dang; rims drag po dang / nyin gcig pa dang / nyin gnyis pa dang / nyin gsum pa dang / nyin bzhi pa dang / rims yud tsam pa dang / nyin mo'i rims dang / mtshan mo'i @459b rims kyis btab pa la yi ge drug pa'i rig sngags 'dis bsrung ba dang / yongs su bskyab pa dang / yongs su bsrung ba dang / yongs su bskyang ba dang / zhi ba dang /
translated: those caused by wind, bile, phlegm, or their combination; those caused by severe fever, one-day fever, two-day fever, three-day fever, four-day fever,🔽or intermittent fever; those caused by fever during the day or at night. If anyone should violate the protection, complete protection, complete guarding, complete care, pacification,

original: bde legs su 'gyur ba dang / chad pa spang ba dang / mtshon cha spang ba dang / dug gzhil ba dang / chus gtor ba dang / srad bus bcings pa byas pa las gang zhig 'gal dar byed na /
analyzed: bde legs su 'gyur ba dang / chad pa spang ba dang / mtshon cha spang ba dang / dug gzhil ba dang / chus gtor ba dang / srad bus bcings pa byas pa las gang zhig 'gal dar byed na /
translated: well-being, removal of punishment, removal of weapons, neutralization of poison, sprinkling with water, or binding with a thread that is done with this six-syllable awareness formula,

original: de'i mgo aa rdza ka'i dog pa bzhin du tshal pa bdun du mi 'gas pa ni /
analyzed: de'i mgo aa rdza ka'i dog pa bzhin du tshal pa bdun du mi 'gas pa ni /
translated: then, Ānanda, unless their head were to split into seven pieces like a lotus,🔽it would be impossible.

original: ngas lha dang bcas pa dang / bdud dang bcas pa dang / tshangs pa dang / dge sbyong dang / bram zer bcas pa'i skye rgu dang / lha dang / mi dang / lha ma yin du bcas pa'i 'jig rten na ma mthong ngo //
analyzed: ngas lha dang bcas pa dang / bdud dang bcas pa dang / tshangs pa dang / dge sbyong dang / bram zer bcas pa'i skye rgu dang / lha dang / mi dang / lha ma yin du bcas pa'i 'jig rten na ma mthong ngo //
translated: I do not see anyone in the world with its gods, Māras, and Brahmas, in this generation with its ascetics and brahmins, gods and men—I do not see anyone who could satisfy the mind like this.🔽Tadyathā:

original: ke yu re /🔽bhu tam ga me /
analyzed: ke yu re / bhu tam ga me /

original: bhu ta pra kshi te; bhu ta ya smra ra ya ni /
analyzed: bhu ta pra kshi te; bhu ta ya smra ra ya ni /

original: bdag 'jigs pa thams cad dang / gnod pa thams cad las bde legs su gyur cig sv'a h'a /
analyzed: bdag 'jigs pa thams cad dang / gnod pa thams cad las bde legs su gyur cig sv'a h'a /
translated: May all fears and all calamities be averted! Svāhā!

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis de skad ces bka' stsal nas tshe dang ldan pa kun dga' bo dang / lha dang / mi dang / lha ma yin dang / dri zar bcas pa'i 'jig rten yi rang ste bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs pa la mngon par bstod do //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis de skad ces bka' stsal nas tshe dang ldan pa kun dga' bo dang / lha dang / mi dang / lha ma yin dang / dri zar bcas pa'i 'jig rten yi rang ste bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs pa la mngon par bstod do //
translated: When the Blessed One had spoken these words, the venerable Ānanda, and the world with its gods, humans, asuras, and gandharvas, rejoiced and praised what the Blessed One had said.

original: 'phags pa yi ge drug pa zhes bya ba'i rigs sngags rdzogs so ////
analyzed: 'phags pa yi ge drug pa zhes bya ba'i rigs sngags rdzogs so ////
translated: The noble six-syllable mantra is complete.
